DOC.brief_summary: This study will evaluates the safety and efficacy of Chimeric antigen receptor T cells (CAR-T) in treating central nervous system B-cell acute lymphocytic leukemia.
DOC.brief_title: CAR-T Therapy for Central Nervous System B-cell Acute Lymphocytic Leukemia
DOC.detailed_description: CNS leukemia is defined as unequivocal evidence of leukemic blasts in the cerebrospinal fluid by cytology or flow cytometry; cranial palsies or a nonhemorrhagic mass seen in cranial computed tomography or magnetic resonance imaging because of infiltration by leukemia cells
DOC.criteria: 1. Patients with CD19 positive central nervous system Bcell acute lymphocytic leukemia 2. ALT/ AST 《 3x normal 3. Creatinine 《 3x normal 4. Age:1060. 5. Signed informed consent 1. Active hepatitis B , hepatitis C or HIV infection 2. Uncontrolled active infection 3. Pregnancy or breastfeeding women 4. Survival less than four weeks
DOC.keyword: CNS B cell acute lymphocytic leukemia
